intro: Leleba multiplex, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, with upright stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and yellow, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Leleba multiplex is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy cultivation requirements.
